ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: AUXILARY SERVICES, ADMISSIONS AND MARKETING, AND TRANSPORTATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED ASSETS ARE RESTRICTED IN PERPETUITY. INVESTMENT EARNINGS ARE AVAILABLE TO SPEND ONCE A CERTAIN THRESHOLD IS ACHIEVED (PER BOARD) AT WHICH TIME WE STILL HAVE YET TO ACHIEVE.
FINANCIAL AID AND DISCOUNTS NETTED AGAINST TUITION REVENUE 1,226,908. DISCOUNTS NETTED AGAINST SUMMER PROGRAM REVENUE 25,140.

THE SCHOOL HAS PUBLICIZED ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IN NEWSPAPERS, MAGAZINES AND BROCHURES.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: FINANCIAL AID, DISCOUNTS AND EMERGING SCHOLARS PROGRAM

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONGRESSIONAL SCHOOL OFFERS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR CHILDREN ENROLLED IN PRESCHOOL THROUGH 8TH GRADE FOR FAMILIES THAT QUALIFY FOR ASSISTANCE. FAMILIES CAN APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID THROUGH THE SCHOOL'S INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTY PROCESSING COMPANY, SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICES ("SSS"), WHO ASSISTS IN EVALUATING THE APPROPRIATE LEVEL OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT MAY BE AWARDED. THESE ARE REVIEWED BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE AND A FINAL MONETARY AWARD DECISION IS MADE. THE SCHOOL COMMUNICATES FINANCIAL AID AWARDS TO THE FAMILY FOR THEIR CONSIDERATION IN THE ENROLLMENT CONTRACT PROCESS. AWARDS ARE ONLY GRANTED FOR ONE FISCAL YEAR AND A UPDATED APPLICATION IS REQUIRED ANNUALLY. CONGRESSIONAL SCHOOL PROVIDES A KINDERGARTEN CREDIT OF $1K PER YEAR FOR EVERY YEAR THE CHILD SPENDS IN THE SCHOOL'S INFANT TODDLER TO PRESCHOOL PROGRAMS. CONGRESSIONAL SCHOOL ALSO OFFERS A DISCOUNT TO CHILDREN OF EMPLOYEES. FOR SUMMER CAMP 2022, A DISCOUNT WAS OFFERED TO CONGRESSIONAL SCHOOL FAMILIES ATTENDING CAMP DURING A SPECIFIC REGISTRATION PERIOD.
A BROKER IS INSTRUCTED TO SELL THE DONATED STOCK IMMEDIATELY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL REVIEWS THE FORM 990 THROUGH CAREFUL EXAMINATION BY THE SCHOOL'S CFO/COO AND HEAD OF SCHOOL. A DRAFT FORM IS ALSO MADE AVAILABLE TO THE SCHOOL'S BOARD, INCLUDING TREASURER, FOR COMMENTS. CORRECTIONS AND CHANGES ARE MADE AND THIS GROUP THEN APPROVES A FINAL COPY TO BE FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL TRUSTEES AND THE HEAD OF SCHOOL SIGN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY EACH YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S ANNUAL COMPENSATION. THE BOARD REVIEWS SALARY SURVEYS AND GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY INDEPENDENT ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS IE (INDEPENDENT EDUCATION), NAIS (NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS), AND ISM (INDEPENDENT SCHOOL MANAGEMENT). SALARY INFORMATION AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES ARE ALL CONSIDERED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, WHICH WOULD RECOMMEND TO THE BOARD, COMPENSATION FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THERE WERE NO CHANGES TO ITS OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR.
